skill.name: tester
skill.description: Comprehensive testing skill for GabeDA application - designs test strategies (UAT, integration, smoke, unit), creates tests for frontend (React/Playwright) and backend (Django/pytest), executes tests, analyzes results, and generates detailed reports with findings. Stores reports in ai/testing/ and tests in appropriate project folders.
skill.summary: Comprehensive testing skill for GabeDA application - designs test strategies (UAT, integration, smok...
skill.author: Brownbull

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill with no executable code. All content is testing guidance and best practices for React/Django applications. No scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond reading own documentation files.

content.value_statement: Manual testing is slow and error-prone. This skill provides structured testing strategies, test creation guides, and execution workflows for React frontends and Django backends using industry-standard tools.
actual_capabilities: Design test strategies for new features and sprints
Create Playwright E2E tests for React frontends
Create pytest unit and integration tests for Django backends
Execute test suites and collect results
Generate detailed test reports with findings
Implement smoke tests for deployment validation
limitations: Does not execute tests directly - provides guidance for users to run them
Requires pre-configured test environments (npm, Python, Playwright, pytest)
Focused on React and Django applications only
Does not modify production code to fix failing tests

use_cases.title: Create E2E test suites
use_cases.description: Design comprehensive end-to-end test suites covering user workflows from login through data analysis

use_cases.title: Write backend unit tests
use_cases.description: Create pytest tests for Django models, serializers, API endpoints, and business logic

use_cases.title: Validate deployments
use_cases.description: Run smoke tests before deployment to verify critical paths are functional

prompt_templates.title: Create E2E test
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an E2E test that logs in a test user, creates 2 companies, and verifies both companies show in the switcher

prompt_templates.title: Run smoke tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Run smoke tests for the frontend and backend and generate a combined report

prompt_templates.title: Design UAT strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Design UAT test cases for the file upload feature with scenarios for valid CSV, invalid format, and large files

prompt_templates.title: Add unit tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Write unit tests for the RUT validation utility using pytest with parametrized test cases

output_examples.input: Create an E2E test for the company dashboard
output: Test covers: Login flow, company creation, company switcher visibility, persistence on reload
Naming follows convention: feature - scenario - expected result
Uses AAA pattern: Arrange (setup), Act (action), Assert (verify)
Recommended locator strategy: [data-testid] attributes for reliability

best_practices: Follow the AAA pattern: Arrange (setup), Act (action), Assert (verify) for readable tests
Use parametrized tests to cover multiple inputs with single test function
Ensure test independence - each test must run in any order without shared state
anti_patterns: Avoid hard-coded sleep or timeout waits - use Playwright auto-waiting mechanisms
Do not use CSS classes or XPath as locators - they are fragile and break on style changes
Never hardcode production credentials - use test fixtures and environment-based configuration

faq.question: What testing frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: Playwright for frontend E2E and component tests, pytest for backend unit, integration, and API tests.

faq.question: Can I test non-React or non-Django applications?
faq.answer: No. This skill is specifically designed for React frontends with Playwright and Django backends with pytest.

faq.question: Does the skill execute tests on my machine?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides guidance, test code, and workflows. Users must execute tests using npm or pytest commands.

faq.question: Is my data safe when running tests?
faq.answer: Yes. Tests use isolated test data and transactions that are rolled back. Never use production credentials.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing?
faq.answer: Check test data setup, verify environment variables, review recent code changes, and ensure dependencies are installed.

faq.question: How is this different from using Claude Code directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides testing-specific patterns, naming conventions, and report formats tailored for CI/CD workflows.
